summary: Jerome A. Cullings was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay during the specified periods. The documents do not provide any specific details about his role within the committee or his involvement in the JFK assassination investigation, only confirming his employment during that time.
significance: Jerome A. Cullings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. The documents suggest he was a staff member, but his specific role and contribution to the JFK assassination investigation are not detailed in these records.
